comment: Smart Data Models - CurveData adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/CurveData/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Multi-purpose data points for defining a curve.  The use of this generic class is discouraged if a more specific class  can be used to specify the x and y axis values along with their specific data types.

contents.name: Curve
contents.comment: The point data values that define this curve. Default: None

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: xvalue
contents.comment: The data value of the X-axis variable,  depending on the X-axis units. Default: 0.0

contents.name: y1value
contents.comment: The data value of the  first Y-axis variable, depending on the Y-axis units. Default: 0.0

contents.name: y2value
contents.comment: The data value of the second Y-axis variable (if present), depending on the Y-axis units. Default: 0.0

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
